item.description:
this site includes ponds, streams, vernal pools, floodplains, rock outcrops, fields, and large tracts of forest. residing fauna: muskrat, painted turtle, wood frog, song sparrow, woodcock, wood thrush, ovenbird, barred and great horned owl, gray fox, otter, mink, fisher, flying squirrel, and salamander. not to mention all the wonderful flora (although, technically, i guess i just mentioned it.)!

this place is wonderful! it was actually first named "mount awesome" (known by locals as "mount blissfully congenial"), but there were so many visitors trampling flowers and crowding trails that administrators determined the name must be changed to discourage the strain of excessive visitation. so don't tell; it'll be our little secret! shhhhh!

be sure and bring your binocs, magnifying glasses, field guides, and other provisions: you'll want to be prepared to behold and absorb the grandeur of mount awesome......er, i mean, mount "MISERY" (wink, wink).
item.how_to_find_us: my vehicle: red jeep with big wheels. plus, i'll be the one beaming with joy (not misery)!
item.why: nature is beautiful (though sometimes miserable.....but not here; and not today.)!
item.name: MOUNT MISERY!!! (don't worry---it's actually a very pleasant location.)
